title: 15 Ways to Make Your Hair Grow Faster & Longer

steps.title: Sulfate tends to make hair more frizzy and dry, which makes it more prone to breakage.
steps.content: Sulfate tends to make hair more frizzy and dry, which makes it more prone to breakage. Instead, use sulfate-free hair care products to protect your hair. Stick to hair care products that are made from natural ingredients, which will keep your hair feeling nourished and moisturized. [1] X Research source Using sulfate-free hair products is particularly important if you dye or use chemical treatments on your hair.

steps.title: With this technique, your hair will be healthier and able to grow out more quickly.
steps.content: With this technique, your hair will be healthier and able to grow out more quickly. After you have finished washing your hair with lukewarm water, rinse it out with cold water to close your hair follicles. This reduces your chances of frizz and hair loss. [2] X Research source Avoid washing your hair with hot or scorching water. This will strip your hair of moisture, making it more susceptible to falling out. You only need to rinse your hair with cold water for a few seconds. [3] X Research source

steps.title: A microfiber towel dries your hair without damaging fragile hairs as a cotton towel would.
steps.content: A microfiber towel dries your hair without damaging fragile hairs as a cotton towel would. Just wrap your hair up in a microfiber towel in the same way that you would with a thick cotton towel. [4] X Research source Air-drying your hair can also help immensely to keep it healthy. Use a microfiber towel to dry your hair to about 60%, and then let the rest dry naturally.

steps.title: Cotton pillowcases create friction with your hair.
steps.content: Cotton pillowcases create friction with your hair. Unfortunately, this makes it more prone to damage and less likely to grow out. Instead, change your pillowcase for something softer, such as silk or satin. [5] X Research source Using a silk or satin pillowcase also means that you will wake up with fewer tangles.

steps.title: Heat styling tools can damage and break your hair since they strip away the moisture.
steps.content: Heat styling tools can damage and break your hair since they strip away the moisture. Let your hair dry naturally, and avoid styling it with curlers or straighteners. [6] X Research source Your hair will be able to grow out faster when it’s healthy and not damaged.

steps.title: Even keratin treatments aren’t a great option for your hair.
steps.content: Even keratin treatments aren’t a great option for your hair. Although keratin is essential for strong hair, the ingredients and high temperatures involved in chemical treatments tend to do far more damage than good. Chemical treatments tend to thin your hair, making it more susceptible to breakage and loss. [7] X Research source Shampoos and conditioners that contain keratin are fine to use, as it’s mainly the process of chemical treatments which is damaging.

steps.title: Shampoo cleans your hair and strips it of the natural oils from your scalp.
steps.content: Shampoo cleans your hair and strips it of the natural oils from your scalp. These are actually there to keep your hair soft and healthy. It’s only necessary to fully wash your hair a few times a week, as this avoids drying your hair out by removing the natural oils. [8] X Research source If you want to feel refreshed on the days in between hair washes, simply rinsing your hair with water will do.

steps.title: Conditioner helps keep your hair healthy, strong, and less breakage-prone.
steps.content: Conditioner helps keep your hair healthy, strong, and less breakage-prone. Once you have rinsed out the shampoo, massage conditioner through your hair. Leave it in for 3-5 minutes before thoroughly rinsing it out. [9] X Research source Read the label on your conditioner to check how long you should leave your specific product in for.

steps.title: Deep conditioner helps keep your hair moisturized.
steps.content: Deep conditioner helps keep your hair moisturized. Heat up your deep conditioner to 35 °C (95 °F) in the microwave before applying it to your hair. Pay particular attention to the ends of your hair, as this is where the hair is the oldest and most damaged. Leave the deep conditioner in for 15-30 minutes before washing it out. [10] X Research source Using a deep conditioner once per week is a good place to begin. If it makes your hair feel weak or limp, try using the deep conditioner once every 2-3 weeks. Alternatively, if your hair still feels dry, try using the deep conditioner twice per week, or even swap your regular conditioner for it.

steps.title: Regular brushing helps to stimulate blood flow to your scalp.
steps.content: Regular brushing helps to stimulate blood flow to your scalp. This means that your strands of hair will be stronger and healthier. Start brushing your hair from the tips to remove the knots, and slowly work your way up. Don’t brush your hair vigorously. [11] X Research source Brushing your hair also helps to distribute the natural oils from your scalp and down to the tips. This keeps your hair moisturized and protected, meaning that it will be able to grow longer.

steps.title: Consistent haircuts help prevent split ends.
steps.content: Consistent haircuts help prevent split ends. Trimming your hair regularly can sound counterintuitive; however, this will help your hair to stay healthy and strong, which means that it will grow longer in the long run. Ask your hairdresser to remove around 0.125 in (0.32 cm) at each trim. [12] X Research source Waiting longer in between hair trims may mean that split ends form, which could result in your hair breaking higher up than where it would be trimmed anyway.

steps.title: Scalp massages promote blood flow to your hair follicles.
steps.content: Scalp massages promote blood flow to your hair follicles. This, in turn, can help stimulate hair growth. Simply place 2 fingertips on your scalp, and move them around in a circular motion. Cover the whole of your scalp, pressing firmly but gently. [13] X Research source

steps.title: These nutrients can possibly help your hair grow.
steps.content: These nutrients can possibly help your hair grow. These include chicken, fish, eggs, and soy products just to name a few. Taking a biotin supplement is also a good way to ensure that you reach the recommended intake of 30 micrograms. [14] X Research source Biotin, also known as Vitamin B7 or Vitamin H helps your body to metabolize fats, carbohydrates, and amino acids. These are the building blocks of protein, which may assist your hair follicles in growing hair faster. Eating a diet that is rich in biotin and protein may also help your nails to be stronger and your eyelashes to grow.

steps.title: Fruits and veggies help your hair, skin, and nails become healthy and strong.
steps.content: Fruits and veggies help your hair, skin, and nails become healthy and strong. You can also take a daily multivitamin if you are concerned that you aren’t getting enough of each vitamin and mineral. [15] X Research source Spinach is a great vegetable to potentially help your hair grow out faster. Spinach is high in protein and vitamins A and C, and each of these helps to moisturize your scalp. Not having enough of these vitamins can make your hair brittle and damaged, which won’t help it to grow quickly. [16] X Research source Broccoli is another great vegetable which may help your hair to stay healthy and strong. Broccoli is rich in A, C, and essential B vitamins, which aids your hair in staying moisturized, as well as growing thick and healthy. If you decide to take a daily multivitamin, make sure that it contains vitamins A, C, and E, to reduce your risk of hair damage and loss. [17] X Research source

steps.title: This helps keep your hair hydrated.
steps.content: This helps keep your hair hydrated. Start drinking more water each day by adding an extra glass, and slowly increasing your intake. Staying hydrated means that your hair may become more moisturized and healthy, which may help it to grow longer over a shorter amount of time. Plain water doesn’t have to be your only source. Herbal tea is also a good option, and many fruits and vegetables have a high water content.
